properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 6 at 3:54PM EST until February 6 at 9:45PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a

* Flood Warning for...
Henderson County in western North Carolina...

* Until 945 PM EST.

* At 350 PM EST, Henderson County Emergency Management reports at
least 12 roads still closed due to flooding across the county.
The heavy rain that caused earlier flash flooding has ended across
the county and less than an inch of additional rainfall is
expected.  Therefore, the Flash Flood Warning has been allowed to
expire and is replaced with a Flood Warning.

* Please obey all barricades and do not drive over flooded roads.
Barricades are in place for your safety and remain in place to
allow engineers to assess road stability before determining they
are safe for travel.

* Mud Creek has crested and is now receding.  It will take several
hours for the stream to fully recede so flooding of low-lying
areas along Mud Creek near Hendersonville will continue through
Thursday evening.

* Some locations that may continue to experience flooding include...
Hendersonville, Mills River, Fletcher, Flat Rock, Etowah, Mountain
Home, Laurel Park, and Bat Cave.
properties.instruction:
Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not attempt to cross
water-covered roadways, bridges, or low-level crossings. Only a few
inches of rapidly flowing water can carry away your vehicle. It is
not worth the risk. Please TURN AROUND, DON'T DROWN.

Numerous roads, parking lots and bridges will be threatened by heavy
rain and rapidly rising streams and creeks. Please pay close
attention to road signs indicating a flood-prone area. Obey all
barricades, even if water is not currently over the road. Barricades
are in place for your protection and indicate areas where flooding
can occur rapidly and without warning.
